alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 9:22PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cheyenne and south central Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 1000 PM MDT... At 921 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles north of Kit Carson, or 21 miles northwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Cheyenne and south central Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
